Opened issue "Document package bootstrapping scenarios" (#8917) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
Not everyone uses NuGet for libraries only. 
The nupkg format is a simple zip with some metadata and it's used for many scenarios. 

We have many features that involve just download packages. 
NuGet.exe install package, direct download, PackageDownload etc. 

All these could yield a nice doc/write-up on all the ways you can do things with NuGet.

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "Build:  environment variable values are truncated" (#8916) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody: Build tasks [like this](https://github.com/NuGet/NuGet.Client/blob/342da27fbd736f79620fd99cf8a9a2671adba75d/build/vsts_build.yaml#L131) print out environment variables, but the longer environment variable values are truncated.

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "Feature ask client side -- Surface PackageType query parameter in the NuGet.org search API" (#8915) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
https://github.com/NuGet/NuGetGallery/issues/7594

SDK team has the nuget gallery ask. And Peter Yu and @joelverhagen suggested it is better have a client side counterpart instead of directly query the web API. So all client side .NET code is in nuget client.

However, in the meanwhile SDK will continue directly using the web REST API since it is relatively simple, and we will migrate to use the client once it is available.

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "[Centrally managing NuGet packages and versions] Add support for Directory.Packages.props import on the msbuild props path" (#8914) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody: NuGet does not have a "props" import path. Work with partners to find the best way to add the import in the props path.

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "[Centrally managing NuGet packages and versions] Partner repo validation " (#8913) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
Partner with internal teams to test the solution on a real repo.
Both functionality and perf need to be validated.

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "[Centrally managing NuGet packages and versions] Internal Performance testing" (#8912) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody: Define a perf matrix (project count, packages per project etc.), generate projects defined in the matrix, collect perf numbers and profile.

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "[Centrally managing NuGet packages and versions] Implement pack necessary changes to include the “Include assets”" (#8911) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody: The pack command for the projects with transitive dependecies will need to include them in pack and respecting the assets.

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "[Centrally managing NuGet packages and versions] Implement the restore graph changes " (#8910) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody: Restore graph will need to consider possible transitive dependecies.

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "1.	[Centrally managing NuGet packages and versions] Implement the necessary MsBuild targets necessary to flow the CPVM information from Directory.Packages.props  to NuGet internals" (#8909) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody: The data from Directory.Packages.props will need to be converted in a dgspec. This task is for the changes needed for this path.

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "[Centrally managing NuGet packages and versions] Prototype - dotnet.exe commands" (#8564) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
Understand what is needed for 

| Command | Status | Notes |
| --- | --- | --- |
| add | Done| https://github.com/NuGet/NuGet.Client/commit/650be9d86b6545b34e08020cfcd5ef22125bc354|
| add --version | Done| https://github.com/NuGet/NuGet.Client/commit/650be9d86b6545b34e08020cfcd5ef22125bc354|
| remove | | |
| consolidate | | |
| consolidate --dry-run | | |
Spec : https://github.com/NuGet/Home/wiki/Centrally-managing-NuGet-package-versions

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "[Centrally managing NuGet packages and versions] Prototype (Visual Studio Integration)" (#8257) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
Create a prototype that will support design and features decisions.

| Index | Experience | Notes |
| --- | --- | --- |
| 1 | Integrate msbuild SDK solution to nuget | The integration worked with integration to nuget.targets. However this allows only managing centrally the package version without any VS or/and other tooling integration |
| 2 | Evaluate usage of a different item type(different than PackageReference) for marking the central package reference | Completed - The different item type will work with new interface for IVsTargetFrameworkInfo. However upon more discussions the best solution is still to use the current PackageReference. Prototype: https://github.com/NuGet/NuGet.Client/commit/c3e8ababa22d2001a2b0349dedca470e22dd2c7d |
| 3 | Evaluate individual projects version overwrite as Item attribute | Completed - This is similar with the MsBuild SDK  |
| 4 | Evaluate individual projects version overwrite as grouping (similar with Paket) | Completed - the grouping need to be activated as in the attached Grouping.zip  | 
[Grouping.zip](https://github.com/NuGet/Home/files/3586100/Grouping.zip)
